verses.text: 產婦潔淨之條例耶和華對摩西說：

words.note: Refers to a woman who has recently given birth.
Often used in religious contexts for ritual purity.
Classical Chinese possessive/subordinating particle.
The covenant name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 「你要告訴以色列人：如果有婦人懷孕，生了男孩，她就不潔淨七天，好像患病污穢的日子不潔淨一樣。

words.note: Refers to the people of Israel.
Here, '不潔淨' (unclean) refers to ritual impurity.
Refers to ritual uncleanness.
Reinforces the state of ritual impurity.
A religious rite of cutting the foreskin.

verses.text: 婦人潔淨產血的時期要住在家三十三天；得潔淨的日子未滿之前，她不可觸摸任何聖物，也不可進入聖潔的地方。

words.note: Refers to the process of becoming ritually clean.
Blood discharge after childbirth, causing ritual impurity.
Refers to achieving a state of ritual purity.
An object set apart for sacred use.
Refers to a state of being set apart and pure for God.

verses.text: 如果她生了女孩，就不潔淨十四天，像月經污穢的日子一樣；婦人潔淨產血的時期，要住在家裡六十六天。

words.note: Ritually unclean.
Refers to the menstrual cycle, which incurs ritual impurity.
Ritually defiled.
Refers to the process of becoming ritually clean.
Blood discharge after childbirth, causing ritual impurity.

verses.text: 「潔淨的日子滿了，不論是為男孩或是為女孩，她都要用一隻一歲的綿羊羔作燔祭，一隻雛鴿，或一隻斑鳩作贖罪祭，帶到會幕門口那裡，交給祭司。

words.note: Often refers to ceremonial purity in biblical texts.
A specific type of lamb for sacrifice.
A type of sacrifice completely consumed by fire.
Often used as an offering for the poor.
Often used as an offering for the poor.
An offering made to atone for sin.
Portable sanctuary used by Israelites.
Religious official who performs rituals.

verses.text: 祭司把供物獻在耶和華面前，為她贖罪，她的血就潔淨了。以上是生育男女的律例。

words.note: Religious official who performs rituals.
Something presented as a religious sacrifice.
The covenant name of God in the Old Testament.
To make amends or reconciliation for sin.
Here, refers to ceremonial purification.
Rules or laws, especially religious ones.

verses.text: 她的經濟能力若是不夠獻一隻羊羔，她可以拿兩隻斑鳩，或是兩隻雛鴿，一隻作燔祭，一隻作贖罪祭；祭司要為她贖罪，她就潔淨了。」

words.note: Young sheep, often used for sacrifice.
Often used as an offering for the poor.
Often used as an offering for the poor.
A type of sacrifice completely consumed by fire.
An offering made to atone for sin.
Religious official who performs rituals.
To make amends or reconciliation for sin.
Here, refers to ceremonial purification.
